response.raw:
Here is my response formatted as requested:

<OUTPUT_TEXT>

# Preparing Legal Documents and Maintaining Filing Systems

1. Affidavit preparation
   - Gather relevant facts and information from client or attorney
   - Draft affidavit using proper legal language and formatting
   - Include necessary components: title, statement of identity, oath, facts, signature block
   - Review for accuracy and completeness
   - Obtain notarization if required

2. Other legal correspondence
   - Draft demand letters, settlement offers, or responses to discovery requests
   - Use appropriate legal terminology and citation formats
   - Ensure all required elements are included based on document type
   - Proofread for errors and clarity

3. Document organization - paper files
   - Create logical file structure with labeled folders and subfolders
   - Use consistent naming conventions for easy retrieval 
   - Implement chronological or alphabetical ordering system
   - Regularly purge outdated documents following retention policies

4. Electronic filing system maintenance
   - Set up digital folder hierarchy mirroring paper files
   - Use descriptive file names with dates for version control
   - Implement document management software if available
   - Ensure regular backups of electronic files
   - Control access permissions to maintain confidentiality

5. General best practices
   - Keep detailed logs of all documents prepared or filed
   - Set up tickler systems for important dates and deadlines
   - Maintain strict confidentiality of all client information
   - Stay current on filing procedures and document requirements

</OUTPUT_TEXT>
response.extracted:
<OUTPUT_TEXT>
# Preparing Legal Documents and Maintaining Filing Systems

1. Affidavit preparation
   - Gather relevant facts and information from client or attorney
   - Draft affidavit using proper legal language and formatting
   - Include necessary components: title, statement of identity, oath, facts, signature block
   - Review for accuracy and completeness
   - Obtain notarization if required

2. Other legal correspondence
   - Draft demand letters, settlement offers, or responses to discovery requests
   - Use appropriate legal terminology and citation formats
   - Ensure all required elements are included based on document type
   - Proofread for errors and clarity

3. Document organization - paper files
   - Create logical file structure with labeled folders and subfolders
   - Use consistent naming conventions for easy retrieval 
   - Implement chronological or alphabetical ordering system
   - Regularly purge outdated documents following retention policies

4. Electronic filing system maintenance
   - Set up digital folder hierarchy mirroring paper files
   - Use descriptive file names with dates for version control
   - Implement document management software if available
   - Ensure regular backups of electronic files
   - Control access permissions to maintain confidentiality

5. General best practices
   - Keep detailed logs of all documents prepared or filed
   - Set up tickler systems for important dates and deadlines
   - Maintain strict confidentiality of all client information
   - Stay current on filing procedures and document requirements
</OUTPUT_TEXT>
